title: Desmond Tutu, Archbishop Who Helped End Apartheid, Dies
sub_head: Nobel laureate and confidant of Nelson Mandela played a big role in bringing South Africa into the modern age
body:
JOHANNESBURG—Desmond Tutu, an Anglican archbishop who led a global campaign to end South Africa’s racist policies and then helped in healing the nation’s wounds, has died. He was 90 years old.
Mr. Tutu’s death in Cape Town was confirmed in a statement from South African President Cyril Ramaphosa, who didn’t say what the cause was. Mr. Tutu was diagnosed with prostate cancer in 1997 and had been hospitalized repeatedly in recent years.
